qas.question: What is the only form potential energy can change into?
What is the only form kinetic energy can change into?
What is preserved in a closed system of forces when acted upon?
What is the force between two locations related to?

answers.text: the difference in potential energy between two different locations in space

qas.question: What is the force called rgarding a potential field between two locations?
A liberal force that acts on a closed system has what kind of mechanical work?
Net mechanical energy is what in an open system?
What can not be considered an artifact of the potential field?

plausible_answers.text: the contour map of the elevation of an area

qas.question: A flow of water can not be considered an artifact of what?

context: A conservative force that acts on a closed system has an <b5_0>associated<b5_0/> mechanical work that allows energy to convert only between <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3>kinetic<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> or <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>potential<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> forms. This means that for a closed system, the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>net mechanical energy<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> is <b6_0>conserved<b6_0/> whenever a conservative force acts on the system. The <b7_0>force<b7_0/>, therefore, is related directly to <a3_1><a3_2><a3_3>the <a3_0>difference in potential energy<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> between two different locations in space<a3_3/>, and can be considered to be <a4_2>an <a4_0><a4_1>artifact<a4_2/><a4_0/> of the potential field<a4_1/> in the same way that the direction and amount of a flow of water can be considered to be an artifact of <b8_0>the contour map of the elevation of an area<b8_0/>.
